intro: Cakile edentula var. americana, commonly known as American rockcress, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. It has basal leaves that are pinnately lobed and often covered in fine hairs. The species is adapted to harsh environments and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
